basics.name: Parth Shah
basics.label: MS Computer Science | ASU
basics.summary: CS grad student at ASU, specializing in AI and data science, experienced in LLMs and data pipelines, seeking Spring 2025 Co-Op and full-time roles post-graduation.

work.name: Quantera.ai
work.summary: Developed data visualization and automation solutions for financial analysis and reporting
responsibilities: Built a visualization engine to extract data, figure plot requirements and generate code to build plots from relevant sources for question-answer pairs. Served this as a single FastAPI endpoint to frontend.
Developed cron jobs to automate daily ETL processes for updating Top 500 US companies' earnings calls.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to enhance data-driven insights for financial analysis.

work.name: Data Mining and Reinforcement Learning Lab
work.summary: Working as a research intern building GraphRAG applications for PDF Question Answering
highlights: Contributed to a major project that streamlined internal workflows, improving efficiency by 30%
responsibilities: Collaborated with Prof. Hua Wei and Longchao Da, contributing to the successful acceptance of our paper at the Agent4IR workshop, part of the 33rd ACM Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (CIKM 2024).
Developed EvidenceChat, a framework enhancing LLMs with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting to ensure trustworthy and evidential response generation.
Engaged in discussions and shared insights with fellow researchers and professionals to drive innovation in AI and information retrieval.

work.name: Ethical Spectacle Research
work.summary: Designed and deployed a backend for the SADIE platform, conducted simulations to analyze network effects, and developed algorithms for AI ethics research, enhancing data accuracy and reliability.
responsibilities: Designed and deployed a robust backend for the SADIE platform, enabling seamless interaction and information storage across multiple language model agents on Weaviate.
Orchestrated simulations with hundreds of agents to analyze emergent network effects, improving data accuracy and reliability by 15% for research.
Developed algorithms to filter toxic and promote constructive ideas, contributing to AI ethics research.

volunteer.summary: Helped organize coding workshops and mentored new members.

projects.name: Vermilion
highlights: Programmed ASU's text-to-video model, Vermilion, as part of the IDP team
Produced data pipelines for datasets like Panda70M, OpenVid1M, and VidGen1M, focusing on recaptioning with local models and preparing for future team integrations

projects.name: EvidenceChat
projects.description: A RAG Enhanced LLM Framework for Trustworthy and Evidential Response Generation.
highlights: Built with JavaScript and OpenWeatherMap API

projects.name: YouTube2Vec
projects.description: A simple task management app to keep track of daily tasks.
highlights: Developed novel language-agnostic vector embedding generator for YouTube videos using multimodal input (including text and images)
Fine-tuned BERT NLP models, enriching youtube8m dataset for 36,585 videos

projects.name: Omnilogue
highlights: Streamlit-based application that allows users to query multiple Language Models
Supports ChatGPT, Claude, Llama 3, and Gemma 2B-9B-IT
